This is an async method. And so is getStreamSegmentInfo.
Please rewrite this entire method to be aynchronous:

public CompletableFuture<Void> copySegment(...) (remove the throws Exception).
Use CompletableFuture composition (thenCompose, thenApply, etc.) to chain your futures together.
Use Futures.loop
return the resulting CompletableFuture.

timeline.bodyText:
What happens when the segment copy is interrupted in the middle (by whatever reason, including a crash)?
From what I can tell, the target segment will be left in an inconsistent state. It will either be empty or have some partial data in it.
Should we change this method to either:

Delete and recreate the segment (i.e., overwrite)
Throw (like now)
Resume from where it left off.

If think #3 is off the table given that it may already contain some other, unrelated data. I would choose between 1 and 2. Does the upstream code handle an exception gracefully? Can it recover from it?
